forecast.name: Tonight
forecast.detailedForecast: Rain after 10pm. Mostly cloudy. Low around 52, with temperatures rising to around 54 overnight. South southeast wind 15 to 18 mph, with gusts as high as 29 mph. Chance of precipitation is 90%. New rainfall amounts less than a tenth of an inch possible.

forecast.name: Wednesday
forecast.detailedForecast: Rain. Cloudy. High near 59, with temperatures falling to around 57 in the afternoon. South wind 18 to 26 mph, with gusts as high as 39 mph. Chance of precipitation is 90%. New rainfall amounts between a half and three quarters of an inch possible.

weather_report:
As night blankets Downtown San Francisco, a shroud of rain quietly approaches, promising a wet embrace before dawn. The sky, draped in muted clouds, hints at the storm brewing in the distance. With temperatures hovering around the low fifties, there is a chill that whispers for warmth. Tonight’s breeze carries a fine promise of rain, its gusts strong enough to sway the trees and whisk away the calm—a notable 29 mph at its peak. Those wandering through the streets may want to don sturdy waterproof jackets, for the chance of precipitation looms large, and any uncovered apparel will soon be rendered soaked.

As the sun rises on Wednesday, it graces the city with a stubborn, cloudy facade. The rain will persist, transitioning the day into a drizzly twilight, with temperatures gently descending into the coolness of the early afternoon. The winds will remain brisk, nudging against the layers you’ve chosen to wear. Given the atmosphere, this isn't a day for grand adventures outdoors but instead a moment for quiet reflection. Consider wrapping up in a comfortable corner café, cradling a steaming cup of coffee while the world beyond your window dances with droplets. Alternatively, a gentle stroll with a well-placed umbrella could reveal the city’s character, even shrouded in gray.
